quotes.quote: Proud is the spirit of Zeus-fostered kings - their honor comes from Zeus, and Zeus, god of council, loves them.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote:
He who knows others is wise;
He who knows himself is enlightened.
quotes.speaker: Lao-tzu

quotes.quote: The king's might is greater than human, and his arm is very long.
quotes.speaker: Herodotus

quotes.quote: An emperor is subject to no one but God and Justice.
quotes.speaker: Frederick I, Barbarossa

quotes.quote: This life of man appears for a short space, but of what went before, or what is to follow, we are utterly ignorant.
quotes.speaker: Venerable Bede

quotes.quote: The voice of the people is the voice of God.
quotes.speaker: Alcuin

quotes.quote: Whoever desires to found a state and give it laws, must start with assuming that all men are bad and ever ready to display their vicious nature, whenever they may find occasion for it.
quotes.speaker: Niccolo Machiavelli

quotes.quote: In the country of the blind, the one-eyed man is king.
quotes.speaker: Desiderius Erasmus

quotes.quote: Do you not know, my son, with what little understanding the world is ruled?
quotes.speaker: Pope Julius III

quotes.quote: We admit of no government by divine rightâ€¦ the only legitimate right to govern is an express grant of power from the governed.
quotes.speaker: William Henry Harrison

quotes.quote: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous, he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and a man.
quotes.speaker: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: The day of small nations has long passed away. The day of Empires has come.
quotes.speaker: Joseph Chamberlain

quotes.quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
quotes.speaker: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

quotes.quote: A single death is a tragedy; a million deaths is a statistic.
quotes.speaker: Joseph Stalin

quotes.quote: Mr. Gorbachev, tear down this wall!
quotes.speaker: Ronald Reagan

quotes.quote: For tomorrow belongs to the people who prepare for it today.
quotes.speaker: African proverb

quotes.quote: The future is not what it used to be.
quotes.speaker: Paul Valery

quotes.quote: I never think about the future. It comes soon enough.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein
